event.summary: 12/14/1993: Twelve technicians, all Christian, from Croatia and Bosnia and Herzegovina were killed in a surprise attack on their living quarters at a construction site in Blida, Algeria. The victims' throats were slit while about 50 attackers took control of the compound for about two hours.
event.motive: To rid Algeria of foreign elements
event.addnotes: In September, two French surveyors working on a pipeline in western Algeria became the first foreigners believed to have been killed by Muslim militants. In October, three French consular employees were kidnapped, then freed with a note threatening all foreigners with death if they did not leave by Dec. 1, 1993. Since Dec. 1st, 16 foreigners had been killed, including a Frenchman, a Russian, a Briton and a Spaniard.
event.scite1: “12 Foreign Workers Slain at Algerian Building Site,” The New York Times, December 16, 1993.
